contentrichtext.text: Nine [[ship]]s of the British [[Royal Navy]] have been named '''HMS''' '''''Penelope''''', after the faithful wife [[Penelope]] of [[Greek mythology]]. * The first [[HMS Penelope (1778)|''Penelope'']] was a 24-gun [[sixth-rate]] launched in 1778 and captured by her Spanish prisoners in 1780. * The second [[HMS Penelope (1783)|''Penelope'']] was a 32-gun [[fifth-rate]] launched in 1783 and broken up 1797. * The third [[HMS Penelope (1798)|''Penelope'']] was a 36-gun [[fifth-rate]] launched in 1798 and wrecked in 1815. * The fourth [[HMS Penelope (1829)|''Penelope'']] was a 46-gun [[fifth-rate]] launched in 1829 but completed in 1843 as a [[paddle frigate]], and sold for breakup in 1864. * The fifth [[HMS Penelope (1867)|''Penelope'']] was an [[armoured corvette]] launched in 1867 that became a [[prison hulk]] in 1897 and was sold in 1912. * The sixth [[HMS Penelope (1914)|''Penelope'']] was an [[Arethusa class cruiser (1912)|''Arethusa''-class]] [[light cruiser]] launched in 1914 and sold in 1924. * The seventh [[HMS Penelope (1918)|''Penelope'']] was a [[Ship's tender|tender]] purchased in 1918 and sold in 1922. * The eighth [[HMS Penelope (97)|''Penelope'' (97)]] was an [[Arethusa class cruiser (1934)|''Arethusa''-class]] light cruiser launched in 1935 and sunk off [[Naples]] in 1944. * The ninth [[HMS Penelope (F127)|''Penelope'' (F127)]] was a [[Leander class frigate|''Leander''-class]] [[frigate]] launched in 1962 and sold to [[Ecuador]] in 1991, which operated her as ''Presidente [[Eloy Alfaro]]''. ==See also== * [[Hired armed vessels|Hired armed]] [[cutter (ship)|cutter]] [[Hired armed cutter Penelope|''Penelope'']] {{Shipindex}} {{Italic title prefixed|3}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Penelope, Hms}} [[Category:Royal Navy ship names]]
